definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
(classical) this, that/he, she, they/(exclamatory final particle)/(initial particle, introduces an opinion)

sentences.english: I have nothing against playing golf.
sentences.chinese: 我對打高爾夫沒什麼意見。

sentences.english: This is a 1-inch putt if you're playing golf.
sentences.chinese: 就如同打高爾夫時的1英寸推杆。
我認爲他們在打高爾夫。

sentences.english: Gates is an avid reader, and enjoys playing golf, tennis and bridge.
sentences.chinese: 蓋茨是一個讀書迷，而且很喜歡打高爾夫和橋牌。

sentences.english: Where do you usually play golf?
sentences.chinese: 你們通常在哪裏打高爾夫？

sentences.english: Bill: Hey, Dan. Do you still play golf?
For relaxation he golfed, swam, and walked.
sentences.chinese: 爲了放鬆，他打高爾夫，游泳，散步。

sentences.english: I play quite a lot of golf, but most people support football team.
sentences.chinese: 我經常打高爾夫，但是大部分人支持足球隊。

sentences.english: They now golfed and lolled around in swanky saunas.
sentences.chinese: 他們現在打高爾夫，懶洋洋地享受時髦的桑拿。

sentences.english: Bill Clinton also golfed, jogged, and played the saxophone.
sentences.chinese: 比爾克林頓喜歡打高爾夫，慢跑，還會吹薩克斯。

sentences.english: I like to play gulf, crack jokes or play badminton.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡打高爾夫，開玩笑，打打羽毛球而已。

sentences.english: And he’s still in Forest, Mississippi. Playing golf.
sentences.chinese: 他仍然住在密西西比的佛羅斯特，經常會去打高爾夫。

sentences.english: As a non-golfer, I felt like a fish out of water at the clubhouse.
sentences.chinese: 我不會打高爾夫，因而在俱樂部覺得有些格格不入。

sentences.english: Up until 20 minutes beforethe raid President Obama was playing golf.
sentences.chinese: 突襲開始前20分鐘，奧巴馬總統還在打高爾夫。

sentences.english: Can you teach me how to pl.
sentences.chinese: 你可以教我打高爾夫嗎？

definition: without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to return something to its rightful owner
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
